cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles (145 km) southeast of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to accelerate north-north-east across the Gulf of Mexico and make landfall along the southeast Louisiana coast before moving quickly inland across MS/AL and the southeastern U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast (between Morgan City and the mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.under_watch: Hurricane Watch (also under Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Morgan City LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Intracoastal City LA eastward to Navarre FL, including southeast Louisiana and Lake Pontchartrain region
weather_observation.wind: Port could experience sustained tropical-storm-force winds (34-63 kt) with a 43% cumulative chance; brief hurricane-force gusts (≤3% chance) cannot be ruled out Wednesday evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels in the lower Mississippi River and Lake Pontchartrain could rise 2–4 ft, with locally higher levels possible on east-facing shorelines.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated totals near 6 inches likely Wednesday–Thursday, producing flash and urban flooding concerns along the river corridor.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rapid rise of river currents, possible barge/ship groundings, and temporary closure of the Mississippi River navigation channel due to high winds and surge.
